title: A Platform for a Transparent, Just, and Free America - Test

items.title: Budget Transparency
items.text: Mandate clear, accessible public reporting of all federal expenditures.

items.title: Accountability in Power
items.text: Public release of the Epstein list to ensure transparency in matters of corruption and abuse.

items.title: Conflict of Interest Reform
items.text: All elected officials and cabinet members must divest from private investments before assuming office.

items.title: End Corruption
items.text: Outlaw lobbying and bribery in Washington; enact real-time disclosure of all political spending and contacts.

items.title: Age Limits for Office
items.text: Impose maximum age limits for both congressional and presidential candidates to ensure generational turnover.

items.title: Supreme Court Ethics
items.text: Enforce binding ethics, financial disclosure, and recusal rules for Supreme Court justices; study options for structural reform and term limits.

items.title: Modernized Elections
items.text: Implement ranked-choice voting for congressional and presidential elections nationwide.

items.title: Redistricting Reform
items.text: Require independent redistricting commissions in every state to eliminate partisan gerrymandering.

items.title: Universal Civic Duty
items.text: Mandatory voting in federal elections with small fines for non-participation. Every voter retains the right to submit a blank ballot or select a formal ‘none of the above.’

items.title: Ban on Encouraging Invalid Votes
items.text: Prohibit organized efforts to promote blank/invalid ballots during elections.

items.title: Voting Accessibility
items.text: Make Election Day a national holiday and require at least 4 hours of paid time off to vote.

items.title: Expanded Electorate
items.text: Lower the voting age to 16.

items.title: Codify Core Rights
items.text: Enshrine Roe v. Wade, Obergefell v. Hodges, Loving v. Virginia, and Griswold v. Connecticut in federal law.

items.title: Free Expression
items.text: Protect speech and assembly on college campuses, including political and anti-war protest.

items.title: Live-and-Let-Live
items.text: Safeguard personal freedoms from undue government intrusion.

items.title: Secular Governance
items.text: Strengthen the separation of church and state: prohibit religious tests for office, bar use of public funds for religious indoctrination, keep government policy and public education neutral on religion, and remove official religious endorsements or symbols from government institutions.

items.title: Universal Healthcare (State-Run Single Payer)
items.text: Replace Medicaid/Medicare with interoperable, state-administered single-payer systems guaranteeing comprehensive coverage in every state, including rural access.

items.title: Prescription Drug Reform
items.text: Tie prices to a global reference basket; significantly shorten patent exclusivity; allow emergency suspension of patents for high-impact public health drugs (e.g., GLP-1s) to ensure access.

items.title: Mental Health Parity
items.text: Enforce equal coverage and access across all plans and networks.

items.title: Reproductive Healthcare
items.text: Fully fund Planned Parenthood and community clinics.

items.title: School Safety
items.text: Federally fund evidence-based security upgrades at schools.

items.title: Social Supports
items.text: Relax SSI/SSDI eligibility; remove SNAP work requirements; raise SNAP income limits.

items.title: Fair Wages
items.text: Raise the federal minimum wage to $25/hr.

items.title: Automatic Cost-of-Living Adjustments
items.text: Index the minimum wage to inflation with scheduled annual adjustments.

items.title: Collective Bargaining
items.text: Protect the right to unionize; ban captive-audience meetings and union-busting tactics; require good-faith bargaining.

items.title: Gig Worker Protections
items.text: End misclassification; if treated as contractors, require core benefits via platform-funded benefits pools.

items.title: Overtime & Misclassification
items.text: Strengthen overtime rules and penalties for wage theft; tighten exemptions.

items.title: Corporate Responsibility
items.text: Increase corporate tax rates and aggressively enforce antitrust laws to break up monopolies.

items.title: Wealth Tax
items.text: Levy a modest annual tax on extreme wealth (e.g., above a high threshold).

items.title: Capital Gains Parity (Under Review)
items.text: Study phased parity of capital gains and ordinary income, with safeguards for retirement savings and small business investment.

items.title: Estate Tax Reform
items.text: Exempt estates under $5 million (indexed to inflation) to support generational wealth-building; impose progressive rates above that, with significantly higher rates on ultra-high-value estates.

items.title: Vacancy Penalties
items.text: Impose substantial fines on properties left vacant longer than 6 months without residents.

items.title: Anti-Corporate Rentals
items.text: Prohibit hedge funds and real estate conglomerates from buying/renting single-family homes; restrict SFR ownership to individuals.

items.title: Community Priority
items.text: Treat housing as a right and curb speculative practices that reduce supply.

items.title: Gun Safety with Amnesty
items.text: Nationwide voluntary gun buyback with full amnesty for surrendering illegal firearms; universal background checks for all purchases.

items.title: Drug Policy
items.text: Decriminalize low-level possession; expand treatment-first approaches.

items.title: Bail Reform
items.text: Eliminate cash bail for non-violent offenses; implement equitable ability-to-pay standards so bail is proportional and does not criminalize poverty.

items.title: Police Accountability
items.text: National use-of-force standards, universal body cams, independent state oversight boards with enforcement power; end qualified immunity; reform police union practices that obstruct accountability.

items.title: Prison Reform
items.text: End for-profit prisons; improve conditions; expand education and reentry; automatic expungement for cannabis and other decriminalized offenses; federally legalize/reschedule cannabis.

items.title: Green Renewal 2.0
items.text: Relaunch a climate/jobs program with deeper investment in renewables, grid-scale storage, and decarbonized industry.

items.title: Grid & Energy Security
items.text: Modernize and harden the national grid; deepen partnerships with allied nations (e.g., Korea) to accelerate advanced transmission, batteries, and clean manufacturing.

items.title: Water Systems
items.text: National program to replace lead pipes, secure reservoirs, and drought-proof critical regions.

items.title: Interstate Upgrades
items.text: Rebuild and thicken interstate roadbeds (Autobahn-style longevity) to reduce life-cycle costs; prioritize safety and freight efficiency.

items.title: Earthquake Resilience
items.text: Adopt Japan-style seismic standards and retrofit programs in quake-prone regions.

items.title: High-Speed Rail & Transit
items.text: Fund national HSR corridors and clean mass transit—ambitious but essential for mobility, climate, and competitiveness.

items.title: Digital Commons
items.text: Classify broadband as a basic utility/common carrier; codify net neutrality; GDPR-style data privacy; Right to Repair across devices and equipment.

items.title: AI Oversight
items.text: Federal AI safety/ethics regulator; risk-tiered audits; transparency for high-impact systems.

items.title: Universal Pre-K
items.text: Free, universal early childhood education.

items.title: Free Childcare for Struggling Families
items.text: Means-tested support to ensure parents can work or study.

items.title: K–12 Funding Reform
items.text: Keep property taxes, but pool them statewide and distribute by student population and need—ending district wealth gaps.

items.title: Tuition-Free College
items.text: Public colleges and trade schools tuition-free; robust apprenticeships and vocational pathways.

items.title: Healthcare Access
items.text: Guaranteed via universal single-payer coverage, mobile clinics, and rural hospital sustainment.

items.title: Support Small Farmers
items.text: Shift subsidies and market power away from agribusiness monopolies; invest in local and sustainable agriculture.

items.title: Trampoline Effect for Sustainable Farming
items.text: Invest in resilience so farms bounce back stronger from shocks: climate-smart practices (soil carbon, cover crops, water capture), diversified farm income (local processing, value-add, agritourism), on-farm renewables and microgrids, methane capture/composting, drought/flood adaptation, and rapid-response grants or reinsurance—building green supply chains and rural jobs.

items.title: Disaster Preparedness
items.text: Scale wildfire, quake (Cascadia), flood, and hurricane readiness with resilient infrastructure and community response funding.

items.title: End Endless Wars
items.text: Reassert congressional war powers; restrict unauthorized overseas interventions.

items.title: Allies & Values
items.text: Maintain robust support for Ukraine’s defense; end U.S. funding for Israel’s military operations; pursue human-rights-centered diplomacy.

items.title: Defense Audit & Transparency
items.text: Comprehensive audits and waste reduction with redactions narrowly tailored to protect operatives, sources, and sensitive capabilities.

items.title: Earned Path to Citizenship
items.text: Create a clear, humane path to citizenship for undocumented residents, including Dreamers—background checks, English/civics, and reasonable fees with access to legal counsel.

items.title: Modernized Legal Immigration
items.text: Digitize case management, expand and right-size visa numbers, clear backlogs, and create regional processing hubs for timely, fair adjudication.

items.title: Humane Border & Smart Enforcement
items.text: Shift from mass detention to case management; significantly reduce ICE workforce; end family separation; prioritize enforcement against trafficking, violent crime, and abusive employers.

items.title: Work Authorization & Worker Protections
items.text: Provide timely work permits and protect workers—regardless of status—from exploitation; decouple status from a single employer to reduce coercion.

items.title: Integration
items.text: Invest in English language learning, credential recognition, and job training so newcomers contribute fully and safely.
